text:
ses, and examples.
Fig 3.6 Placement of ECG leads.

--- Page 115 ---
101
Cardiovascular medicine
Fig 3.7 Left bundle branch block: wide QRS with a W pattern in V1 (slight notching in upstroke of S wave—clearer in V3) and the M pattern in V6. WiLLiaM = LBBB.

--- Page 116 ---
102
Cardiovascular medicine
Fig 3.8 Right bundle branch block—broad QRS, M pattern in V1 and sloped S wave (with the eye of faith, a ‘W’ shape) in V5. MaRRoW = RBBB.

--- Page 117 ---
103
Cardiovascular medicine
Fig 3.9 Acute infero-lateral myocardial infarction: marked ST elevation in the inferior leads (II, III, aVF), but also in V5 and V6, indicating lateral involvement. 
There is a ‘reciprocal change’ of ST-segment depression in leads I and aVL; this is often seen with a large inferior myocardial infarction.

--- Page 118 ---
104
Cardiovascular medicine
Fig 3.10 Acute anterior myocardial infarction—ST segment elevation and evolving Q waves (the ﬁ rst QRS deﬂ ection is negative) in leads V1–4.
